channel.title: MoparClassic Alpha Release & Bug List
channel.description:
named from Pre-beta to Alpha
[B]CLIENT IS HERE: [/B]: http://216.24.201.81/
Log in with any username, password does not matter.
Note: Client is not finished, title, logo and other things have not been touched since RSCA
this is simply a time to report server-side bugs and anything out of the normal. XP rates are 20x during this beta
report all bugs in this thread, enjoy.
If server goes down, jump on IRC and ask either me, CodeForFame or Rodgerwilco to log the error and restart it.
for each bug that you report, depending on the seriousness of it, you will be rewarded when the server goes live.
[b]do not report bugs that are based upon saving/loading, as it's using a temporary method and will be changed upon beta[/b]
[b]REPORT ALL P2P/MEMBER BUGS, AS THIS IS SUPPOSED TO BE SET UP AS F2P/'FREE'[/B]
Format: <Bug Reporters Name> <Issue> <Status>
[b]XML Bugs:[/b]
xEnt: remove 'young spirit tree' teleporter from lumby Lightone: remove the man under bank at edge that wants to give u a gift box for "7 event tokens" Lightone: there is an wizards upstairs in Jolly Boar Inn (varrock pub near wild)? Rov: fix champs guild door requirements & add escape ladder imthenull: Varrock rune shop has 400 of each rune, change to 50 imthenull: remove varrock fountain
[b]Client Bugs:[/b]
xEnt: client's command window needs to be cleaned from all the println's Rodgerwilco: remove ::noloot from client
[b]Server Bugs:[/b]
All day: make abbot langley heal, like monks. and also tell people they need 31 pray for pray guild CFF: the drain rate doesn't seem to update if you take off items with a prayer bonus with the prayer already activated. CFF: If you wear a monk/priest robe and turn on thick skin, or burst of strength it will never drain. Rov: champs guild ladder, make it move up to 151, 1505 (right now its in middle of ladder) All day: add brimhaven gate manually (after p2p radius loading)
[b]Fixed Bugs:[/b]
??: magic not giving xp imthenull: remove the @ran@ message upon login, and add a MOTD xEnt: new characters - all current stats start at 0. xEnt: make dueling p2p xEnt: add restriction for npcs dropping member items xEnt: removed random npc talking text. Rodgerwilco: change fletching and other messages to 'This feature is only available on a members server' Rov: disable dart, arrow head & throwing knife smithing. xEnt: telegrab block in certain areas needs to be removed Rov: disallow alching of member items (if you happen to get one) xEnt: disable lv 5 enchant Rov: disable camelot teleport and other p2p magic spells All day: disable entrana monks from taking you to entrana hikkili: changed mining guild text to say 60, not 66 xEnt: champs guild door can not be opened right now (due to not having all quests)
-- ALPHA COMMANDS ONLY -- Added ::say <msg> Added ::item <id> Added ::goto <playername> Added ::town <townname>

item.title: MoparClassic Alpha Release & Bug List
item.dc:creator: @Crooks Crooks
item.description:
@Crooks wrote:

Found some tiny bugs while I was playing around with moparscape classic. I will post it here since I can’t remember my pw on github.

Client; Hatchet - You can wield it but the sprite won’t show up in your hand.

Server; resetOnlineFlag & setOnlineFlag does not work properly. If you start the server and logging in with a character it will update the players table with (world = 1 , online = 1)
If you logout, the DB will still save your char with (world = 1, online 1)
Untill you put server offline it will display (world = -1, online 0).

The quest goblin diplomacy doesn’t work. (you can’t start it).

Also found an ugly thing while I was going to test the goblin diplomacy I walked above the goblin area on the mountain near zamoraks hut. When I noticed I was walking wrong I clicked on the map at the goblin area it started to walk 15-30 squares then randomly took a shortcut crossed the mountain straight to the spot.

Excuse my English. I hope you can understand the post.

Read full topic

item.title: MoparClassic Alpha Release & Bug List
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

[quote=“Motaro, post:41, topic:428402”]Certing should be like it is in RSC - no cert/uncert all option.[/quote]I agree completely.

[quote=“xEnt, post:46, topic:428402”]i highly disagree on removing certs, nobody is going to mine or fish if u have to do the cert crap.[/quote]People will still cert whether the bank option is there or not. There may be less people selling fish/ores and shit for a while, but that’s just a bonus for the people who are taking the time to cert.

Read full topic

item.title: MoparClassic Alpha Release & Bug List
item.dc:creator: @The_Djinn The Djinn
item.description:
@The_Djinn wrote:

   public static ItemDef getItemDef(int id) {
                if (id < 0 || id >= items.length) {
                        return null;
                }
                ItemDef item = getItemDef(id);
                if(item.isMembers())
                {
                        ItemDef memberItem = new ItemDef();
                        memberItem.name = "Members item";
                        memberItem.description = "You can only use this item on a members server";
                        memberItem.wieldable = false;
                        memberItem.basePrice = 0;
                        memberItem.command = "";
                        memberItem.members = true;       
                        return memberItem;
                } else {
                        return items[id];
        }
}
public boolean members;
	public boolean isMembers() {
		return members;
	}

Read full topic

item.title: MoparClassic Alpha Release & Bug List
item.dc:creator: @all_day All Day
item.description:
@all_day wrote:

[quote=“The Djinn, post:42, topic:428402”][quote author=Motaro link=topic=531094.msg3881830#msg3881830 date=1326079570]
Certing should be like it is in RSC - no cert/uncert all option.
[/quote]
Ew, never. I like this little custom added in.
I don’t want to waste 10+ hours certing my rune ore that I’m going to no life and hoard the economy with.[/quote]

Although it is efficient it should be removed.

Read full topic

It promotes activity.[/quote]Specifically, it keeps people in Dray for extended periods of time.

item.title: MoparClassic Alpha Release & Bug List
item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

[quote=“CodeForFame, post:37, topic:428402”][quote author=-Nothing link=topic=531094.msg3880152#msg3880152 date=1325977062]

[quote author=CodeForFame link=topic=531094.msg3879818#msg3879818 date=1325961038]

[quote author=-Nothing link=topic=531094.msg3879783#msg3879783 date=1325957980]

[quote author=CodeForFame link=topic=531094.msg3879723#msg3879723 date=1325954569]

@CFF, Did you fix the problem where your connectionfilter banned people for nothing?
[/quote]What are you talking about? Just raise the threshold, or lower the time they’re ‘banned’ for.

Well I got banned for logging in so…
[/quote]You tried to log in too many times per amount of time… Change it in the config if it’s too strict.

I clicked login once.

Not sure if this is cause of the connectionfilter too, but when you walk around you sometimes get dc’d and ur unable to login for a while.

And there’s some bug that causes everyone to disconnect at the area where it happens, some say it’s the magic, because it usually happens while CTF war, and most people use magic there.
[/quote]That wouldn’t be from the connection filter then.

Are exceptions being thrown, or is it intentionally DCing people? Maybe there is a bug with the way XP is distributed, but that doesn’t have anything to do with the connection filter.

If there were exceptions thrown I would have fixed it by now. It’s just DCing people randomly.

Oh and there’s another bug that I got reported about, when you mage/range a npc and finish it with melee, it doesn’t give any xp at all to melee stats.
[/quote]How exactly should it work?

I don’t have membership or a decent account to see.

Isn’t XP divided between players? Also, should you get full melee XP if you mage/range it to 1hp then melee it?

Currently, it gives the magic XP properly, and distributes the XP proportional to the method used to kill it, for each player.[/quote]
It gives magic xp, but not combat exp. Have you tested it? Or do you just think it works correctly?

Read full topic

item.title: MoparClassic Alpha Release & Bug List
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote="-Nothing, post:27, topic:428402"][quote author=CodeForFame link=topic=531094.msg3879818#msg3879818 date=1325961038]

[quote author=-Nothing link=topic=531094.msg3879783#msg3879783 date=1325957980]

[quote author=CodeForFame link=topic=531094.msg3879723#msg3879723 date=1325954569]

@CFF, Did you fix the problem where your connectionfilter banned people for nothing?
[/quote]What are you talking about? Just raise the threshold, or lower the time they’re ‘banned’ for.

Well I got banned for logging in so…
[/quote]You tried to log in too many times per amount of time… Change it in the config if it’s too strict.

I clicked login once.

Not sure if this is cause of the connectionfilter too, but when you walk around you sometimes get dc’d and ur unable to login for a while.

And there’s some bug that causes everyone to disconnect at the area where it happens, some say it’s the magic, because it usually happens while CTF war, and most people use magic there.
[/quote]That wouldn’t be from the connection filter then.

Are exceptions being thrown, or is it intentionally DCing people? Maybe there is a bug with the way XP is distributed, but that doesn’t have anything to do with the connection filter.

If there were exceptions thrown I would have fixed it by now. It’s just DCing people randomly.

Oh and there’s another bug that I got reported about, when you mage/range a npc and finish it with melee, it doesn’t give any xp at all to melee stats.[/quote]How exactly should it work?

I don’t have membership or a decent account to see.

Isn’t XP divided between players? Also, should you get full melee XP if you mage/range it to 1hp then melee it?

Currently, it gives the magic XP properly, and distributes the XP proportional to the method used to kill it, for each player.

Read full topic
